title: Aboriginal canoe trees of the Murray
creator_credit: Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies, South Australian Museum and Robert Edwards
brief_description: Aborigines of the lower Murray River formerly made large canoes from the bark of Red Gum trees. This film documents the felling of a canoe tree from the sides of the Murray and its transportation to the South Australian Museum for preservation.
creator_credit_for_label: Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies, South Australian Museum and Robert Edwards
